overview: This subject will expand the knowledge of transthoracic echocardiography by learning pathophysiology and assessment of ventricular function, including in diastolic function.

• The Cardiac Cycle
  • Left Ventricular Systolic Function Pathophysiology
  • Evaluation of Left Ventricular Function
  • Right Ventricular Systolic Function
  • Right Ventricular Function Evaluation
  • Atrial Function and Pressure Estimation
  • Diastolic Function Pathophysiology
  • Assessment of Diastolic Function
  • Management of Diastolic Function
  • HEARTscan Studies
ilo: Evaluation of right ventricular systolic function
Understand diastolic function pathophysiology and assessment
generic_skills: Improve written skills and problem solving skill

Prerequisites.content: Admission into one of the following:

content: GC-CLINUS Graduate Certificate in Clinical Ultrasound
GD-CLINUS Graduate Diploma in Clinical Ultrasound

Prerequisites.content: This subject is not available for students admitted in any other courses.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: One open - book multiple choice examination consisting of 50 questions, students will have 1 week to complete the examination
Completion of self assessment modules at the end of each tutorial
